item.title: The costs of Israel's longest war, for Israelis
item.description: Israelis are paying heavy costs for the longest war in their history: a mental health crisis, trauma, unprecedented division during wartime, animosity abroad and apathy for Palestinian suffering.
item.content:encoded:

(Image credit: John Wessels)

item.title: Democrats take legal aim at 'the Radical Left' language during shutdown
item.description: Democrats and a federal union argue the Trump administration's language posted on federal agency websites and in some emails blaming the "Radical Left Democrats" for the government shutdown is in violation of a 1939 federal law.

item.title: These numbers show how 2 years of war have devastated Palestinian lives in Gaza
item.description: It's been two years since Hamas-led militants attacked Israel, killing some 1,200 people and taking 251 hostages. In response, Israeli leaders promised a punishing offensive. Here are some numbers showing the war's toll.

item.title: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
item.description: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees that federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not apply to furloughed workers.

item.title: The government shutdown is snarling air travel. Officials say it could get worse
item.description: A dozen facilities saw air traffic control shortages on Monday, delaying flights at several airports. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy blamed "a slight tick-up in sick calls" due to the shutdown.
